official-title.#text:
Recognizing the 50th anniversary of the
		  first ascent of Mt. Everest by United States citizens.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
honors Mr.
			 Whittaker for his leadership in the outdoor recreation community; and

recognizes the
			 extraordinary feat Mr. Whittaker accomplished 50 years ago and how his story
			 has inspired countless people in the Northwest and beyond.

Whereas Mr. Whittaker was a part of a team led by Swiss
			 Mountaineer Norman Dyhrenfurth, that consisted of 19 United States
			 mountaineers, scientists, writers, and photographers, who were assisted by
			 dozens of Sherpas and hundreds of porters, became the first United States team
			 to reach the peak of Mt. Everest;

Whereas Mr. Whittaker and the team stood as heroes and
			 inspired the country during a time when the Nation was consumed with the
			 ongoing struggles of the Cold War, the Cuban Missile Crisis, high unemployment,
			 and the looming war in Vietnam;

Whereas upon returning, the team was recognized at a
			 reception in the White House Rose Garden, where President John F. Kennedy
			 presented each with the Hubbard Medal of the National Geographic
			 Society;

quote.#text:
a riveting saga of high adventure by one of history’s greatest
			 climbers

text.#text:
Whereas Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., has called Mr. Whittaker’s
			 story

Whereas Mr. Whittaker was the first full-time employee of
			 one of the country’s largest outdoor retailers, Recreational Equipment, Inc.,
			 and went on to retire as its President and Chief Executive Officer after 25
			 years with the company;

Whereas throughout his life, Mr. Whittaker has lived his
			 life to the fullest, leading numerous, high-profile climbing expeditions,
			 including the first ascent of Mt. Kennedy, which was completed with Senator
			 Robert F. Kennedy in the Canadian Yukon in 1965;

Whereas Mr. Whittaker also led the first ascent by a
			 United States citizen of K2 in 1978, and the successful Mt. Everest
			 International Peace Climb in 1990; and

quote.#tail:
and has shared his story in person as a motivational speaker:
			 Now, therefore, be it
quote.#text:
A Life on the Edge: Memoirs of Everest and
			 Beyond

text.#text:
Whereas Mr. Whittaker is the author of the best-selling,
			 award-winning memoir,
